statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Texas Southern edges Mississippi Valley State in 3 OTs 85-84
article.headline: Texas Southern edges Mississippi Valley State in 3 OTs 85-84
article.linkText: Texas Southern edges Mississippi Valley State in 3 OTs 85-84
article.story: GREENWOOD, Miss. -- Tonnie Collier scored 26 points -- including two free throws with 11 seconds left in triple-overtime -- and Texas Southern edged Mississippi Valley State 85-84 on Monday. Collier's free throws came after Isaac Williams' jumper put MVSU up 84-83 with 19 seconds left. MVSU had one last possession, but a turnover and foul by Billy Jackson sealed it. MVSU had the last shot in regulation and the first two overtimes, but missed each time in its upset bit. MVSU's Vacha Vaughn forced overtime with his lone basket of the game, a layup with 50 seconds left. Texas Southern's Malcolm Riley prompted the third overtime with a jumper with 25 seconds left. Collier was 8 of 14 from the floor and made five 3-pointers for Texas Southern (9-11, 6-1 Southwestern). Madarious Gibbs added 17 points. MVSU (2-18, 1-6) was led by Williams with 26 points. DeAngelo Priar had 17 points and 13 boards.
